review: My wife likes to hang onto things and is not one for unnecessary change, so when the battery of her iPhone 6 suddenly failed I looked for a more up-to-date replacement. This pre-owned device has provided a useful and workable replacement, and I am happy with the purchase. This iPhone SE 2020 is a good replacement. The size is the same as the iPhone 6, the battery life has a modest improvement, it fits her previous phone case although the camera lens is not in exactly the same place. There is also the improvement gained from a hardware upgrade. My wife does not push the technology so for her the upgrade appears as an improvement in run-time when looking at TicTok. She also noticed an improvement in the quality of photos after I modified her phone-case so that the lens was not obscured. There are no complaints and that is all I wanted. This iPhone SE 2020 has a small physical size, so if you are looking for a 'phone' without a massive screen this is a good choice. The 'home' button is no longer a physical switch, it has a haptic system which simulates the 'click' and works quite well. Migrating from the old phone was a breeze thanks to Apple's tool which is intended to help you upgrade your phone. The thing you need to know, and I discovered this by trial and error, is that youmust put your SIM into the new phone before you start the migration otherwise things do not happen.Less

review: iPhone SE 2022 Review I felt compelled to write this review after I had read so many other reviews before making this purchase. And I think this little powerhouse of a phone deserves it. I have just spent a year with the IPhone 13. But moved to this phone. The iPhone SE 2022 is quite literally punching above its weight. With the same A15 Bionic CPU that is found in Apple's flagship model (13 Pro), extended battery life, 5G network capabilities and the option of larger memory size. This mobile really stands up for itself. One thing I've read so much about from trusted reviews and other comments is the criticism of the form factor / screen size. For me, the size of this was one of the MAIN reasons to get this phone. I don't want a huge, heavy phone in my pocket. The 4.7" is in my opinion just perfect, and with the iPhone SE you hardly notice it at all. Its easy to hold and use and very light. It also uses Touch ID which I actually prefer than FaceID as it's quicker and more convenient. It was a shame to hear that this could be the last time Apple support this smaller size and are moving the next SE to a larger screen, another reason why I wanted to get this version before they do. This phone for me is perfect in every way, and if you are able to, I would go for the larger 256GB memory size to really future proof this device.Less

review: I needed to upgrade from my old Iphone SE 1st generation due to it being about to become unsupported. I loved the small form factor of the 1st generation SE and there was nothing as small as that any more. I have very small hands, even for a woman so was not happy about getting anything bigger and some phones are much bigger. I was worried this might be too big and heavy. It's fine. I have to say I was a bit grumpy that it seemed unnecessarily wider and heavier, but I got used to it within a few days and now prefer it. I also like having the touch id still. It might not look as flash as the more expensive iphones but you get a lot for your money. It does the job. Screen is slightly smoother for scrolling. Initially I set it to automatic speakerphone as thought it was too bulky to use as a phone to your ear, but have even got used to that now. The only other "small" phone was the 12 or 13 mini. I would have preferred one of those for size but don't like OLED screens which give me headaches. The SE 3rd generation is a good phone for all in my opinion. Now if they'd just made it half a centimetre less wide. But lets face it we use our phones more like tablets really and not so much for phone calls as other things and for that it's perfect. Does calls as well.Less

review:
Been a Android user since the Nexus 1 and have used many brands (Asus, Samsung, Motorola) and my last one was a Pixel 4a 5g.  I bought my first Apple product last year (iPad Air 4) and really was surprised about the use of iOS that I decided to get a iPhone so the SE 2022 (Red 128gb) fit what I was looking for, a simple iPhone entry into the Apple world.

The SE 2022 is very snappy and fast (the A15 chip is awesome) plus the size is great for 1 handed use (I do have decent sized hands) also the Battery is decent for I am not a power user (don‚Äôt play games/watch videos etc) and has lasted me all day without a need to recharge (5g T-Mobile here) and the price is great if you want into the iPhone ecosystem.  The SE 2022 takes great pictures and if you really need a small iPhone to take better pictures then a 13 mini is a great choice.

Now the bad is night shots the SE 2022 cannot do, yet all the other iPhones can.  And the body really could have been upgraded instead of some from 2017.

So if you want a entry, basic IPhone without all the bells and whistles then this phone is the one for you.  

No buyers remorse here and a happy 1st time iPhone owner üôÇLess

The SE can give you a general location like it is located in a grocery store. If it had the U1 chip it would give you an arrow and information on exactly how far away to 1/10 of a foot. The SE will let you play a sound on the Airtag so if your object is in a small room you can find them. I did find out the battery doesn‚Äôt always last as long as I like, but I also could turn off my hot spot and location information to extend the battery life, but I like them on. Over all if you don‚Äôt need the lenses or precise finding I like the SE.Less

review: My wife convinced me to upgrade from my iPhone 6S, which I had been using for seven (7!!!) years. The SE 3rd gen was a perfect fit for me--it has all the features I liked in my old 6S, plus way more memory, enhanced apps, and better camera/sound. I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't need a phone the size of a tablet. I see a lot of complaints here about the battery life being too short. I just haven't found this to be an issue with my SE. I also like the price; it's very affordable for an Apple product. I paid the whole thing off after three months. My experience with this phone is so positive I broke down and bought my first Mac. Apple make very solid products in my opinion.

review: Loving this phone! The battery life is long and the camera is just great. No issues with internet connection, even though I bought the Chinese version. The seller included an adapter and a transparent phone case in the order. The phone has a protective screen film on it. Everything works perfectly and I can absolutely recommend the seller and the phone. About shipping: I made the order on 18 July and the phone was sent on 28 July. It arrived to Russia on 19 August and was delivered to me by a courier on 23 August. The weight changed by exactly 10 grams at the border, which worried me, so I opened the package in front of the courier (it's your right and you should do so to be safe) and filmed it, but luckily my worry was for nothing. All in all, a good experience.

review:
I would like to just say that I got this phone as an upgrade from my Samsung Galaxy S9. I have been always intrigued by 1+ but never felt like their phones ever really checked all the boxes for me. I always liked the design of Samsung phones but liked the camera and pure vanilla Android experience you get from a Google Pixel (R.I.P. Nexus). Then enters the OnePlus 9. And WOW! I haven't loved a phone this much since my Moto X (yes I had a custom built one-of-a-kind etched and everything Moto X, just shows you the kind of nerd you're dealing with). I'll compare my experience with some you might find on YouTube.
1. Camera, I feel like this camera is the best phone camera I have had to date. Far better than my Galaxy. I don't know if there was a software update but Damn this thing rocks. All my pictures have had amazing details and the color reproduction is amazing as well.
2. Soft Haptics, I don't know if this is a phone to phone thing and I do have a T-Mobile 5G model but the haptics on this thing are strong and satisfying, and don't feel cheap at all. They remind me of my PS5 controller. Especially when you find out that the phones preloaded alarms make use of the haptics as well.
3. The Screen, this one I was most worried about coming from a Galaxy with a 4k screen. Do not fret however this screen is amazingly crisp, color reproduction is beautiful. There are plenty of settings to tweak it so it's most comfortable to your eyes which I love. The only down fall it's not the brightest in the game but still plenty bright! And oh my Lord how a 120hz display changes your life! Something you just have to see in person!
4. Battery, I work at a hospital with almost no cellphone signal all day and I'm constantly on WiFi. My Galaxy wouldn't survive a single shift with out needing to be charged with heavy usage. This thing... I've used it like crazy all day and at this time of writing this review I'm still at 50% so for me personally that's pretty damn good.
5. OS, by far the best Android experience ever. Better than Pixel's. Oxygen OS has everything you want from vanilla Android and then just this beautiful amount of extra simplicity and customization added on top.
6. Sound. This category I feel like gets over looked during reviews at time. The sound quality is absolutely amazing. I don't know how to explain it. I feel like Dolby Atmos and the native intelligence of this phone just produce a better sound quality than my Galaxy. I left my settings to dynamic but switched the intelligence setting over to "Warm" and my ears are in love! Also quick side note my Galaxy used to produce this weird high end "staticy pop" when it was paired with my Fossil Sport Watch and my 2011 Hyundai Sonata at the same time and I was playing music via Bluetooth. The OnePlus 9?  No interference what so ever. Pure crystal clear sound coming from my cars infinity audio system. I was so extremely overjoyed (might be a slight audiophile üòâ) that this simple correction justified the cost of a new phone in my heart immediately.
7. Cost, I think we'll end here. While I did get an awesome deal through T-Mobile, they gave me $365 for my Galaxy S9 (in monthly credits of course). $730 MSRP for this phone is an absolute bargain!!! I seriously can't recommend any other phone out there at this moment for this price. Once you have it in your hands it all makes sense. The phone feels way more premium than what the price tag may suggest. But that's just my opinion, thank you for taking the time to read this review and if you did I hope it helped!Less

review:
I previously had the Samsung Note 10.  I don't like the bloat ware with Samsung phones so I wanted to give something else a try.  This phone always came up in top 10 android phone reviews so I bought it directly from company online.  I wish I could return it.  The phone function doesn't even work half the time.  When I look online it seems this is a common issue.  People can't call me and I can't call out either at random times so I have to shut off phone or restart it to even make call.  It locks up or freezes up if you try to have multiple apps open.  It drops calls & disconnects from my vehicle blue tooth connection frequently. 
Battery life isn't great either but luckily it comes with a rapid charger because you will definitely need it.  The only other positive things I can say is the camera is pretty good and speaker is loud but that's about it.  I don't know how the phone possibly received good reviews because I can't stress enough how much I hate this phone.Less

review:
Note had to place review here because OnePlus isn't letting me post it directly on their site!!

üò™üò™. Let me start off by saying I became aware of OP back in 2019 August. I noticed my carrier (T-Mobile) was selling the OP 7P. Never heard of it I had a iphone 6s plus at the time because my Samsung note 8 broke. So I was interested in the OP 7P, watched one review on YouTube by MKBHD & I was sold lol. So I got it & instantly became a Huge OnePlus fan. The OP 7P was & still is the best phone I've ever used. 

Now here I am about a year & half later with the OP 9P. This phone overall to me feels slightly tweaked compared to the OP 7P. So yes it feels like an upgrade but not much seeing as I skipped the OP 8P ü§î. I received my OP 9P back at the end of March when I pre-ordered it. The very first thing I noticed when I got it was the MASSIVE OVERHEATING & TRASHY CONNECTION!!! I mean my phone was blazing HOT. Which NEVER HAPPENED with my OP7P even while gaming on it & still to this day. So I was super worried & disappointed quickly after just starting to use my brand new $1k plus phone compared to the $700 OP7P.

So here I am a little over 2 months later after numerous updates to the OP9P and yet still having the same issues. Now I've heard that the customer service was pretty poor here at OnePlus but I've never had a problem until now. I've been back in forth with the customer service team about my issues and they're telling me in order to fix the phone they need to do a remote session to find the problem on my phone? You would think that someone who has brought your product, spending over $1000 would be able to just simply get a new replacement especially under warranty. Nope they insist on doing a remote session with the device to see IF THEY CAN FIND THE ISSUES. I'm truly disappointed with the way the handle my situation. Especially with all the hype of this phone you think they would have made sure simple issues like that wouldn't be a thing especially on their Flagship Device. Definitely feels like the settled & rushed the 9 series. I can't even return the phone back for a refund. OnePlus I trust & love your brand but this is unexpectable. 
Super disappointed with this issue.

The main reason on this 1 star rating is that in comparison to my previous phone the (OnePlus 7 Pro) it barely feels like an upgrade. I enjoy the screen on 7Pro better especially the size. The screen on the OnePlus 9 Pro is long and narrow. The battery dies almost just as fast as my 7Pro. Also the overheating is just unbelievable and unbearable at most times. Connection to T-Mobile is patchy especially the 5G.

PROS
  Color (Pine Green)
  Camera
  Screen display
  Warp Charge
  Speakers
  Feeling in hand

CONS
  Battery
  Overheating
  Connection issues (call drops poor connection to 5G)
  Performance (slow laggy at times)
  Having to restart consistently
  Quantity (numbers) don't match Quality-Example my OnePlus 7Pro loads just as fast ex. Google, games, YouTube, apps etc.Less

review: While this phone has many recommendations for it, I recommend against it. On Android 11, I wasn't confident in user experience. But with Android 12 update - it confirms my suspicions and doubts. Android 12 update is riddled with bugs and at times making things like GPS and viewing photos after taking a picture unusable. The software quality with these phones are progressively getting worse with each iteration. The Snapdragon CPU is appealing but what's the point when you can't use the phone for what it's made for? In addition, the camera quality is poor and the update has even made sound quality worse. All this, on top of rising prices of these OnePlus phones is probably why I won't buy again from OnePlus.

review:
Absolutely!üòé

OnePlus 9 would be a worthy upgrade from the OnePlus 6

Reaons -

You get more processing power so multitasking will be even faster
A gorgeous 120Hz display for buttery smooth animations in the UI and all the apps that support it (you'll see the magnitude of the difference if you go back to a regular 60Hz display).
A camera setup that can match the standards of the flagships.(Again if anything earlier than 2018 OnePlus models)

review: I never written reviews but I was VERY compelled to write this review. I returned this phone the same day it was delivered. The phone screen was scratched up with red paint chipping on the back of the phone where the camera bump is at. As an earlier reviewer of this phone said about a year ago, the speaker was EXTREMELY DISTORTED, even at low volumes. I compared it with the speaker of my iPhone 8 Plus from my carrier and it was day and night different. Best Buy charged me $45 re stocking fee even though the phone DID NOT come shrink wrapped in a box. It came delivered in one of those bubble wrap envelopes that you buy at a major supermarket retailer. They didn‚Äôt even ship it in a cardboard box. I am EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED that Best Buy would even sell products like this with an EXTREMELY DISTORTED speaker. It came with 85% battery life and on iOS 15.1. Everyone please be aware expect to pay $45 re stocking fee if you are not satisfied with the condition you received the phone. I even checked off that the phone came defective on the return reason. My only regret is not taking photos to upload to this review since I was so upset upon receiving the phone.Less

review: My 9 year old daughter saved up and bought an iPhone 8 Plus which looked fine, turned on, and seemed to respond just fine. I could not get the phone to activate, though, no matter what I tried. I finally took it to an Apple Genius Bar and after a couple of hours they told me the GSM antenna wasn't responding, causing the device to not be able to activate. I contacted Noble Planet Inc. and asked if there was anything that they would be willing to do since they sold my daughter a device that would never have worked. All I got back was a canned response saying that I was outside the time-frame for returns. I was out of that time frame. They are "correct" and I wish I had had the time to look into it sooner. I wish, however, that they would have offered us something more than a lesson to my daughter that we live in a world where technicality all too often trumps humanity.Less

Later on he took it out to clean it and once again dropped it. This time on the face of it. So the glass cracked in many places. He was still able to use the phone for quite some time. review: Im in my late 20s working full time, trying to save every cent and this phone is perfect for me. Just upgraded from a 6s. I had planned on keeping that old phone a little longer, but with the new September updates the battery life was really going fast. The 8plus, although over two years old and used, has amazing battery life. I might charge once or twice a day if I really use it all day long. Or else its more like once every 2 days. The display is fantastic. I dont see the need for OLED, fullscreen, or even facial recognition. At this time, I prefer the older style look of my big bezels and home button/print scanner. Since this was the last model that offered this style, it was a no-brainer for me. I absolutely adore the home button, call me afraid of change if you want- I just like how it feels. Jumping from gen 6 to this, the button is no longer press-able, and instead vibrates when pressure is applied. It was love at first touch. The camera is noticeably better than my old phone and on par with the iPhone X camera, which is the main reason I got this model. The processor chip is also efficient and still super speedy. Which is a much needed breath of fresh air. I love the fact that I can now do the wireless pad charging. While I am not a huge fan of the all glass bodyfor durability reasons, cases have always been a requirement for the iPhone anyway. Also purchased on eBay, is my new clear Otterbox Symmetry case because I absolutely love the look of this phones White glass with Silver trim- so I did not want it covered up. It reminds me of my first smartphone, the cheap iPhone 5c which I used for 5 long years. Times are changing though and each new year leaves the older models exponentially further in the dust, beaconing you to upgrade. This is my first Plus sized model as I was very content with the increased screen size from the iPhone 5 to 6 jump. With this new purchase though, I am thinking I will definitely stick to the plus models from now on. Im a big guy with large pockets and hands. So the size and weight are totally preferable and make me feel like a hotshot. One final note I would like to mention as there is a ton of negative stigma behind it- the missing aux port/ headphone jack. Was there room for it? Probably. Do I miss it a little? Not even a TINY bit. I already had Bluetooth headphones (earbuds are not my thing) and grabbed a tiny Bluetooth box for my car as that only has the aux port for my radio. The connection is ridiculously easy and quick. Now I dont have to deal with aux cords always fraying and no longer working or giving me a ton of static. I have absolutely no complaints about this phone and it was a much needed upgrade. Maybe Ill get another two year old phone on eBay in 2021 XD. The only thing I wished it had was dual speakers at the bottom. For some reason, I thought it did, but one of them is actually a barometer for determining altitude which is good to know.Less

review: I upgraded from an iPhone 5s to a Space Gray iPhone 8 Plus, and I feel like I stepped into the future. The increase in battery life, the quality of the screen, the amazing camera, the speed, and the extra storage space are all fantastic. It's a much larger device than my previous one, but since I use it more as a small computer than as an actual phone, I am thankful for the extra screen real estate. Many of these improvements I anticipated based on my research prior to purchase, but the biggest surprise is the improved battery life. I get at least twice the battery life I was seeing on my iPhone 5s, and that's with a brand new battery only recently installed in the 5s. I used Android devices exclusively until I purchased my iPhone 5s, and I continue to prefer the integrated Apple hardware and software ecosystem. Android has better swype-typing keyboards, but in most other respects I prefer Apple's experience. Everything about this phone is a step up from my older iPhone, except the loss of the headphone jack. Bad move, Apple. I hope they bring it back.Less

review: This is the best small screen phone out there - if you are someone who wants a phone that can be operated using just one hand, this is the last one out there. The iPhone X is a similar form factor but has a 5.8" screen - which is bigger than the iPhone 8 Plus, not necessarily one handed operation. For someone coming from an iPhone 6 series, the iPhone 8 is a big step up in performance. It is absolutely silky smooth and the GSM+CDMA version is the one to buy - with the Qualcomm modem. While bezel-less phones are the biggest rage these days - this phone represents the best iteration of a bezel phone with TouchID. The display even though is low on pixel count - is still a big step up from the previous iPhone and still looks fantastic on all videos and photos. TouchID is even faster than before. Camera is also better than the iPhone 6, 6S and 7. It is a single lens camera, but in my opinion it isn't that big a difference unless all the pictures you take are in low light or in other words it isn't a deal breaker. All the iOS 11 features work great on this phone (iPhone 6 with a new battery is still slower) and the newer features like wireless charging are nice additions. The glass back does make it easier to shatter on a drop - so you definitely need a case. The glass phone is heavier- but I tend to like that. Summing up - if you want to stay in iOS (for iMessage, FaceTime etc.) this is the best small size phone for the price and the blazing fast performance. At the price point of $699 (which is inching up almost every year) - I don't think you can beat this to stay in the iOS ecosystem.Less

review: My phone arrived a little over a week ago. The packaging made me a bit anxious: it was wrapped in bubble tape but rolling around among not enough packing material in a larger box than it needed. However, once I booted it up and inserted my own SIM card (it came with one which I am saving as a backup),it roared to life. I took it to T Mobile to port over my information and most of it went easy peasy. I like the clarity of the screen and the camera is fabulous. It seems to have a decent battery life but since it's so new I can't confirm that. I am all around happy with this 8+. I didn't want the fingerprint and face recognition features of the ten and this one is as good when you compare the specs. I am a satisfied customer and recommend this company.

review: I ordered the iPhone 8 Plus 64GB in Silver excellent condition. I bought an AT&T iPhone 6 3 years ago from Gazelle and it worked just fine.
